title: 104_hr3117
content: AUTHORITY TO ESTABLISH AND OPERATE MANAGED HEALTH-CARE PLANS. The Secretary may establish managed health-care plans under Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, to deliver health care services through Department facilities or other entities, in consultation with the Secretary of Health and Human Services. The Secretary may establish managed health-care plans under Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, to deliver health care services through Department facilities or other entities, in consultation with the Secretary of Health and Human Services. The Secretary shall prescribe minimum health care benefits for veterans enrolled in the plan, including those covered under Medicare. An enrollment system may be established for veterans not described in a specific section. Cost-sharing requirements may be set for veterans enrolled in the plan to cover additional benefits not paid by Medicare. The Secretary may establish managed health-care plans under Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, to deliver health care services through Department facilities or other entities. Cost-sharing requirements may be set for veterans enrolled in the plan to cover additional benefits not paid by Medicare. Payments received for care provided to veterans shall be used to pay for furnishing care and services. The Secretary may not operate a plan at a Department facility unless sufficient medical care funds have been allotted for that fiscal year. The Secretary must ensure that sufficient medical care funds are allocated to Department facilities for the fiscal year to provide necessary hospital care and medical services to veterans. New sections are added to the table of sections in Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code. Establishment of managed health-care plans. Requirement for payment for certain services provided by Department facilities. The new section 1729A of Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, allows the Secretary of Health and Human Services to make Medicare payments to Department managed health care plans for veterans who are Medicare-eligible individuals. This includes veterans enrolled in managed health care plans under similar terms as payments made under title XVIII of the Social Security Act. The new section 1729A of Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code allows Medicare payments to Department managed health care plans for Medicare-eligible veterans. The Secretary certifies health care plans that meet prescribed standards under section 1705. The term 'Medicare-eligible veteran' refers to veterans entitled to benefits under the Medicare program. The new section 1729A of Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code allows Medicare payments to Department managed health care plans for Medicare-eligible veterans. The term 'Medicare-eligible veteran' means a veteran entitled to benefits under the Medicare program. The term 'Medicare Choice organization' refers to a managed health care organization under part C of title XVIII of the Social Security Act. Section 1729A of title 38, United States Code allows Medicare payments for Medicare-eligible veterans. Effective after the enactment of this Act.
